title: Requires tenants in housing court to be given certain information in bold print at the end of any petition for eviction
summary: Requires tenants in housing court proceedings be given information pertaining to their rights including that only a judge may issue a warrant to evict them; they should assert any defense or counterclaim in their answer, that they have a right to have the premises inspected to confirm any claim of dangerous or unhealthy conditions, that they may have a right to withhold rent for failure to make repairs and that OCA sells information to residential tenant screening companies.
lawSection: New York City Civil Court Act
actClause: AN ACT to amend the New York city civil court act, in relation to requiring the housing court to provide certain information to tenants
